short_summary: Construction of a Net Zero Ready modular duplex in Fort Chipewyan, AB
description: This solicitation is for the construction of a residential building using a design-build method. The project includes architecture, engineering and construction services required to install a Net Zero Ready modular duplex in Fort Chipewyan, AB. The project value is between $1,001,001 and $2,500,000, exclusive of taxes.
full_summary:
***

Government of Canada Tenders
---------------------------

### Fort Chipewyan Staff Housing – Wood Buffalo National Park

#### Solicitation Number: 5P468-23-0271/A

#### Solicitation Status: Closed

*   **Solicitation Closing Date:** April 4, 2024, at 16:00:00
*   **Expected Contract Start Date:** April 18, 2024
*   **Expected Contract End Date:** March 31, 2025

### Request for Proposal (RFP) Summary

Parks Canada Agency (PCA) invites qualified and experienced contractors to submit proposals for a design-build construction contract to complete a Net Zero Ready modular duplex in Fort Chipewyan, Alberta.

#### Project Overview

The proposal is for a two-submission bid, following the instructions outlined in the Special Instructions to Bidders (IB06). The contractor must perform and complete the work by March 31, 2025.

#### Requirements and Conditions

*   The contractor must have experience in architecture, engineering, and construction services.
*   The project value is estimated to be between $1,000,001 and $2,500,000, including taxes.
*   The contractor must have the necessary bonding and insurance coverage.
*   All work must be performed according to the National Park Act and its accompanying regulations.

#### Submissions and Communication

*   Submissions must be made via email or fax, as specified in the solicitation document.
*   The email address for submissions is <soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca>.
*   The fax number for submissions is 1-855-983-1808.
*   Enquiries regarding the solicitation must be submitted in writing and received at least five business days prior to the closing date.

#### Additional Information

*   A bidders’ conference will be held via teleconference on January 25, 2024, to review the solicitation and answer questions.
*   Bidders must obtain documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service to participate.

### Documents and Attachments

*   All documents, including addenda, are available on the Government of Canada’s tendering service at <http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities>.
*   Bidders must ensure they have the most up-to-date version of the documents.

### Contact Information

*   For any questions or enquiries, please contact:
    *   Name: Ken Lacanilao
    *   Email: <k
